title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #294: Egyptian Fractions and t(N)**

Let t(N) = min{t : no Egyptian representation of 1 exists with denominators in [t, N]}.

**Question:** Estimate t(N).

**Solution:**
- Erdős-Graham (1980): t(N) ≪ N/log N
- Liu-Sawhney (2024): t(N) ≫ N/((log N)(log log N)³...)

**Status:** SOLVED

title: Unit Fraction
content:
**unitFraction:**

1/n for positive integer n.

```lean
def unitFraction (n : ℕ) : ℚ := 1 / n
```

Unit fractions are the building blocks of Egyptian fractions.

title: Egyptian Sum
content:
**egyptianSum:**

∑_{n ∈ S} 1/n for a finite set S.

```lean
def egyptianSum (S : Finset ℕ) : ℚ :=
  ∑ n ∈ S, unitFraction n
```

An Egyptian fraction is a sum of distinct unit fractions.

title: Egyptian Representation of 1
content:
**isEgyptianRepresentationOf1:**

A set S with egyptianSum(S) = 1.

```lean
def isEgyptianRepresentationOf1 (S : Finset ℕ) : Prop :=
  S.Nonempty ∧ (∀ n ∈ S, n ≥ 1) ∧ egyptianSum S = 1
```

Example: {2, 3, 6} since 1/2 + 1/3 + 1/6 = 1.

title: Constrained Representation
content:
**hasConstrainedRepresentation:**

Can we represent 1 using denominators only from [t, N]?

```lean
def hasConstrainedRepresentation (t N : ℕ) : Prop :=
  ∃ S : Finset ℕ, S.Nonempty ∧
    (∀ n ∈ S, t ≤ n ∧ n ≤ N) ∧
    egyptianSum S = 1
```

This is the core question: which intervals [t, N] allow such representations?

title: The t(N) Function
content:
**t_func:**

t(N) = min{t : no representation of 1 exists in [t, N]}.

```lean
noncomputable def t_func (N : ℕ) : ℕ :=
  Nat.find (⟨N + 1, ...⟩ : ∃ t, ¬hasConstrainedRepresentation t N)
```

This is the central object of Problem #294.
mathContext: t(N)-1 is the last starting point that works.

title: Harmonic Sum
content:
**harmonicSum:**

H_N = ∑_{k=1}^N 1/k ≈ log(N) + γ.

```lean
noncomputable def harmonicSum (N : ℕ) : ℚ :=
  ∑ k ∈ Finset.range (N + 1), if k ≥ 1 then unitFraction k else 0
```

The harmonic sum grows logarithmically, which connects to t(N)'s behavior.

title: Erdős-Graham Upper Bound
content:
**erdos_graham_1980:**

t(N) ≪ N/log N.

```lean
def erdosGrahamUpperBound : Prop :=
  ∃ C : ℝ, C > 0 ∧ ∃ N₀ : ℕ, ∀ N ≥ N₀,
    (t_func N : ℝ) ≤ C * N / Real.log N
```

From the 1980 monograph. They admitted no knowledge of the true order of t(N).

title: Liu-Sawhney Lower Bound
content:
**liuSawhneyLowerBound:**

t(N) ≫ N/((log N)(log log N)³(log log log N)^O(1)).

```lean
def liuSawhneyLowerBound : Prop :=
  ∃ c : ℝ, c > 0 ∧ ∃ C : ℕ, ∃ N₀ : ℕ, ∀ N ≥ N₀,
    (t_func N : ℝ) ≥ c * N / ((Real.log N) * (Real.log (Real.log N))^3 * ...)
```

This matches the upper bound up to polylog factors.

title: Main Theorem
content:
**erdos_294:**

t(N) ≍ N/((log N)(log log N)^O(1)).

```lean
theorem erdos_294 : liuSawhneyTheorem :=
  liu_sawhney_2024
```

The Liu-Sawhney theorem resolves Problem #294.

title: Density Interpretation
content:
**almost_all_work:**

Almost all t ∈ [1, N] allow representations.

```lean
def densityInterpretation : Prop :=
  ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N₀ : ℕ, ∀ N ≥ N₀,
    (N - t_func N : ℝ) / N > 1 - ε
```

The 'bad' starting points form a sparse set of density ≈ log(N)/N.

title: Greedy Algorithm
content:
**greedy_terminates:**

The greedy Egyptian fraction algorithm always terminates.

```lean
axiom greedy_terminates (q : ℚ) (hq : 0 < q ∧ q < 1) :
    ∃ S : Finset ℕ, egyptianSum S = q
```

Repeatedly subtract the largest unit fraction ≤ q.

title: Summary Theorem
content:
**erdos_294_summary:**

```lean
theorem erdos_294_summary :
    erdosGrahamUpperBound ∧
    liuSawhneyLowerBound := by
  exact liu_sawhney_2024
```

Combines both bounds into the complete solution.

title: Problem Status
content:
**erdos_294_status:**

**SOLVED**

- Upper bound: PROVED (Erdős-Graham 1980)
- Lower bound: PROVED (Liu-Sawhney 2024)
- Asymptotic: t(N) ≍ N/((log N)(log log N)^O(1))

Resolved up to polylogarithmic factors in 2024.
